column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.2

#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=Eat Bread at a Dinner Party
#Text=The bread !
#Text=Often it 's the first source of sustenance for a starving dinner guest
#Text=but wait !
#Text=Not so fast !
#Text=Is it rude to start breaking it open and chowing down before you 're even seated ? !
#Text=There is basic etiquette attached to eating bread at the dinner table .
#Text=This article only deals with etiquette relevant to some anglophone cultures .
#Text=It is possible other cultural requirements exist for eating bread in other parts of the world - asking first is a good idea if you do n't know !
#Text=Steps
#Text=Wait before breaking bread .
#Text=It is quite possible that you 're starving , but it is ill-mannered to eat the bread without respite before the first course arrives at the table .
#Text=If bread is sitting on the table already , wait until the first course is served before helping yourself to it .
#Text=If bread is handed out by a waiter , allow the waiter to use bread tongs to place it on the plate .
#Text=Do not be tempted to stick your hand into the waiter 's basket and grab more !
#Text=Ask instead .
#Text=And again , wait until everyone has started eating .
#Text=Eat the bread carefully .
#Text=A dinner party is not the time to display breakfast table bread habits .
#Text=Instead , break apart the bread into small pieces using your fingers .
#Text=Do not cut the bread or bite into the large part of the bread .
#Text=If you wish to add butter to your bread , add it to each small piece after you have broken it .
#Text=Place the broken bread onto the bread and butter plate .
#Text=This small plate is found just above the dinner plate and is used to hold the bread and butter .
#Text=Using your bread , place a small bit of butter onto the bread and butter plate next to your bread .
#Text=Do not " double dip " into the butter dish .
#Text=Take only what you need from the butter dish and place that onto the plate .
#Text=Carefully add neatly spread butter onto your hand broken pieces of bread with your hands .
#Text=Beware the bread bloat .
#Text=While some people are very careful not to overdo the bread , others consume too much at the dinner table and cannot eat all of their meal .
#Text=Avoid this by remembering that bread is the support cast and not the star .
#Text=If you 're still starving later , you can raid the fridge at home , out of sight .
#Text=Tips
#Text=Note that many functions such as weddings , conferences , etc. , will only cater for enough bread to go around per person once .
#Text=If you ask for additional bread and it is refused for this reason , do n't despair ( and equally , do n't take it out on the poor waiter ) .
#Text=The best thing to do is to ask if the waiter can return to you with more bread if any is left over .
#Text=There are always people on low-carb diets , etc. , who refuse their share of bread .

#Text=If you have special dietary needs , allergies , etc. , such as not consuming dairy or gluten , ask the waiter quietly at an opportune moment if the bread ingredients are known ; be clear that you have an allergy or dietary issue with certain ingredients .
#Text=If it cannot be ascertained with certainty or ease , simply refuse the bread politely .
